dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Oh, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: I don't suppose it's any consolation, but if she *were* still alive, the age difference would be insurmountable.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: She was part of me plan. I never got round to telling her, but she was going to come with me to Fiji. She was going to wear a white dress and ride the horses and I was going to take care of everything else. It was me plan. I planned it.

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: Well, she won't be much use to you on Fiji now. Not unless it snows and you need something to grit the path with.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Holly!

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm sorry about that. I've been on my own for three million years, and I'm just used to saying what I think. I think I've gone a bit peculiar, to tell you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: So everyone's dead? I'm on me own? There's just me?

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: Well, technically speaking, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: What do you mean, 'technically speaking'?

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Hello, Lister. Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Rimmer! You're a hologram?!

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Yes. That's because I'm dead. Dead as a can of spam. And it's all thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Me? What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: If you hadn't kept that stupid cat, Lister, and hadn't been sent to stasis, I would have had some help when I was mending the drive plate, and I wouldn't be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: What's it feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Death? It's like being on holiday with a group of Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: No, I mean being a hologram.

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Do you mind? Being a hologram is fine, Lister. I still have the same drives, the same feelings, the same emotions, but I can't *touch* anything. Never again will I be able to brush a rose against my cheek, cradle a laughing child, or interfere with a woman sexually.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Rimmer, you never used to do any of those things anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: But I would have done one day, murderer!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Hey, hey! I didn't do anything! It was *you* who didn't fix the drive plates properly.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Aaahhh! Holly, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: During the radioactive crisis, Dave, your cat and her kittens were safely sealed in the hold. And they've been breeding there for three million years, and have evolved into the life form you just saw in the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: Well, you know how mankind evolved from apes?

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Holly
dialogues.text: He evolved from cats. His ancestors were cats. He's descended from cats. He is a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Aaahhh, ooowww, eee! How am I looking? (He pulls out a small mirror.) Looking nice. No, wait a minute. I'm looking better than nice. I'm looking dangerous. Aaaoooww, dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Hello... Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Whoa! Crease!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Here you go, Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Ah, Krispies!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Holly says you like these.

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Mmmm!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Where are all your other catty friends, Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Good Krispies, man!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: But where are all the other little kitties? Are they gone? Are they dead? Have they left you?

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Who cares? I want it off the ship!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: No! He's coming home with us, aren't you, Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Home? And where exactly is home supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Rimmer
dialogues.text: Earth? What makes you think there'll be any Earth, Lister? And even if there is, look what it's done to a household pet in three million years.

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Frankenstein? The Holy Mother? The Virgin Birth? No one believes that stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: No, it was a big black tom on Titan.

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Frankenstein, yeah! I remember that stuff from kitty school. The Holy Mother, saved by Cloister the Stupid, who was frozen in time, and who gaveth of his life that we might live.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: No! No, it's not Cloister, it's me, it's Lister! It's *Lister* the ... stupid?!

dialogues.speaker: Cat
dialogues.text: Who shall returneth to lead us to Fushal, the Promised Land.

dialogues.speaker: Lister
dialogues.text: No, it's not Fushal, it's Fiji! And I will! I'll lead you there. (To Rimmer) *That's* where we're going. Holly, plot a course for Fiji. Look out, Earth -- the slime's coming home!
